comment: Bold flavor upfront with an immediate bite.  The bourbon then smooths out to a delicious finish!  Well done!
Seems woody and smoky, but I'm not sure those are really the right descriptors.  Smooth and easy to drink, overall very pleasant.

Color: honey, light copper, great legs

Nose: vanilla, butterscotch, hint of oak; very inviting 

Palate: light, minty, lots of vanilla, caramel, balanced oak undertone; as advertised by the nose

Finish: modest heat; tapers off fairly quickly, but lingers with wintergreen

Good, but would be better with more body and around 100 proof. It feels a bit watered down. The mint/wintergreen aftertaste is really nice.
Nice and smooth, light minty oak and vanilla on the palate. Slight burn on the finish with the mint lingering.
easy sipping, slightly sweet with a burn on back end

Nose: oak, spicy, pepper

Mouth: juicy, dark baking spices, classic bourbon flavors, fairly huge

Barrel 995 - simply delicious.  Vanilla on the nose with a bit of ethanol.  It starts with nuttiness and caramel, maybe a hint of chocolate.  Apples pick up before the alcohol hits.  A bit of cinnamon and clove with the burn.

I’d expect a single barrel to be at least 90 proof, but for ~$30, this definitely brings enough complexity to really enjoy.  It’s an easy sipper that is smooth and enjoyable for any occasion.  Mint is a common theme, with a nice balance of sweetness.  Medium finish.  Overall a solid pour!  7.9/10
Great! Oak with a bit of heat. Much depth and complexity. If I could find this barrel (1265) again I would buy a case immediately! Can’t find anything better for the price!

Nose: Red Apple, Pepper, Oak, Young grain, Sour rye

Taste: Pepper, Cinnamon, Oak, heat, Buttery finish, Somewhat mellow rye, Quite mellow so the bottle is probably pretty oxidized

Just a hint of medicine on the nose. Certainly not offensive. In the mouth and in the finish it is a very good bourbon. I almost rated it higher but nothing really distinguishes it from a stereotypical bourbon. Typical flavors of vanilla, spice and some nuttiness, but all underwhelming.
I’m no pro.  I prefer a little less burn and slightly sweeter.  It does go down easily and is tasty for the price. Made an excellent Old Fashioned.
Really great corn sweet and with a vanilla chocolate oak finish. For the price this is a better than average daily drinker.
Hello peanuts. Poured a tall dram, drank half, poured the rest out. Wont do again.

Bottle poured neat into Glencairn at home. Barreled on 7-23-10, barrel 49, bottled on 11-27-17. Nose has the caramel and butterscotch I loved from the 2011, though not as prominent; lots of oak comes on, along with some heat. Taste is oaky and spicy, with some citrus notes. Nice long aftertaste, drinks a tad hotter than the proof.  Decent, though I prefer the 2011.  6/9/19

2010: 
Nose: having trouble getting much. Very smooth. My bottle be too oxidized. Some grains and young oak.

Taste: lots of yummy bright spices rolling around with green apples and oakyness. Lasting spice tingling finish.
Smooth. First smell was vanilla. Nice with or without ice. Nice finish. Not a veteran, but it’ definitely pours a nice glass.
